com.adobe.aem.init.dogmatix.config

Interface ServerConfig.CONFIGS

  • Enclosing class:
    ServerConfig

    public static interface ServerConfig.CONFIGS
    Possible configuration keys in the server XML settings file

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CommandPort
      A valid system port on which the server listens for commands.
      static String HTTPPort
      A valid system port on which the server listens for incoming HTTP requests.
      static String HTTPVersion
      The protocol to be adhered while serving requests and building responses.
      static String KeepAliveTimeout
      The timeout value in seconds when the server responds with a Keep-Alive header.
      static String MaxThreads
      Maximum number of threads allowed in the JVM instance that the server is running in before it starts rejecting further incoming requests.
      static String ShutdownGraceTime
      The waiting period in seconds, before halting the server forcefully.
      static String StopCommand
      Linked to the CommandListener, the Stop command is the command to look for in the GET request which will be received on the CommandPort for shutting down the server.

    • Field Detail

      • HTTPPort

        static final String HTTPPort
        A valid system port on which the server listens for incoming HTTP requests. It should be available at the time of startup. [REQUIRED]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CommandPort

        static final String CommandPort
        A valid system port on which the server listens for commands. Commands are actions requests sent as HTTP GETs. Upon receiving a command request the server is expected to perform an action. Currently, it is only used to instruct the server to shutdown and fetch the server runtime statistics. [REQUIRED]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MaxThreads

        static final String MaxThreads
        Maximum number of threads allowed in the JVM instance that the server is running in before it starts rejecting further incoming requests. Very broadly, it translates into the concurrency limit. This should not be tampered with unless you know what you are doing. A low value might result in a high rate of request rejections. A high value might result in frequent OutOfMemory exceptions. [REQUIRED]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTTPVersion

        static final String HTTPVersion
        The protocol to be adhered while serving requests and building responses. [REQUIRED]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ShutdownGraceTime

        static final String ShutdownGraceTime
        The waiting period in seconds, before halting the server forcefully. This time is utilized by threads to exit gracefully while releasing any blocked I/O resources. May be increased if your application has frequent long I/O blocking operations, like 3rd party web service requests. If too high, will cause a delay in server shutdown and have no other effect on its operation whatsoever. [REQUIRED]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • StopCommand

        static final String StopCommand
        Linked to the CommandListener, the Stop command is the command to look for in the GET request which will be received on the CommandPort for shutting down the server. This has been made configurable for an installation to have the flexibility in declaring its own protocol. It is case-insensitive. [REQUIRED]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KeepAliveTimeout

        static final String KeepAliveTimeout
        The timeout value in seconds when the server responds with a Keep-Alive header. Clients having the capability to persist connections will wait for this amount of time before closing the connection. [REQUIRED]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
